_header: Before six days of Easter on Palm Sunday eve / Jesu came
Note:
Cf. 3766, 3767. Earlier editions of Brown and Robbins (1943)
XCarleton Fairchild Brown, and Rossell Hope Robbins. The Index of Middle English Verse. New York: Printed for the Index Society by Columbia University Press, 1943 treated section headings of this work as separate entries (e.g., 126, 396, 409, 443, 578, 719); for a discussion of reasons for their deletion see Pickering (1973)
XPickering, Oliver S. “The Temporale Narratives of the South English Legendary.” Anglia 91 (1973): 425-55, 443, n. 36.
_description: ‘The Southern Passion’, in several MSS of the South English Legendary — couplets

Bod779.First Lines:
After two dawes ȝe wete wel þat ester schal comeWhan
                    goddes son schold be I take to gewes & ek I nome…
Bod779.Last Lines:
…lord as þou fulfildist þy postlis wit þe holygost
                    in erþe soso fulfille vs here in erþe to heuin þat we
                    streyȝt go
Bod779.Note:
Several texts (1546,
                        5334, 2105, 2106, 2120, 2647, 5809) that follow this treated as part of this in that
                    no separate headings for them; altogether 1673 lines.The final two lines of 5809 (“& bryng vs to oure eritage In to þy wonyng / þou graunte vs lord þat we so mote Ihesus almyȝty kyng.”) appear earlier in the MS on f. 41r.
Bod779.Attributed Title:
Passion of crist (f. 25v); þe hiȝe feste of
                    Whitsonetyd (f. 172)

BodEngPoeta1.First Lines:
BI fore six dayes of Aster as a palmesone eueIhesu com to Betanye
                    þer to bi leue…
BodEngPoeta1.Last Lines:
…Now Ihesu for þe swete Crois þat þou weore onne i
                    doBring vs to þe ioye of heuene þat þou vs bouhtest to.
                    A.M.E.N.
BodEngPoeta1.Note:
5809 treated separately (fols.
                        25vb-26ra) but probably should be regarded as a
                    subsection of 787.
BodEngPoeta1.Facsimiles:
Doyle,  I. A.,
                        ed.  
             The Vernon Manuscript. A Facsimile of Bodleian Library, Oxford, MS Eng.
                poet.a.1,
          with an introduction by A. I. Doyle. Cambridge: D. S. Brewer, 1987. 
Scase,  Wendy,  and  Nick Kennedy, eds.  
             A facsimile edition of the Vernon manuscript: Oxford, Bodleian Library, MS. Eng. Poet. A. 1.
         Oxford: The Bodleian Library, 2011.

BodTan17.First Lines:
Before vi daies of esterne as a palm son eueIhesu cam to bethame
                    þere to be leue…
BodTan17.Last Lines:
…Now ihesu for þi swete cros þat þou were onne I
                    doBringe vs to þe ioye of heuen þat þou vs bouȝtist
                    to
BodTan17.Note:
2616 lines; break between this text and the heading of the
                        Resurrectio comes 24 lines earlier in this MS than usual, thus
                    ending, ‘pour seint siluester þe pope þat oure lordis bodi also
                    / Schal be saccid up þe auter and in pur lyne cloþ I do’ (f.
                    69)

OxfTri57.First Lines:
By fore sixe dayes of ester as a Palm son eueIhesu com to Bethanye
                    þere to by leue…
OxfTri57.Last Lines:
…Now ihesu for þe swete crois þat þu were on y
                    doBringe vs to þe ioye of heuene þat þu vs boȝtest
                    to
OxfTri57.Note:
1588 lines; break between this text and the heading of the
                        Resurrectio comes 12 lines later in this MS than usual, thus ending,
                    ‘Ac hol by leuede his þrow and noþyng vndo / I hol by leuede his
                    moder wombe þo he was ybore al so’ (f. 14v); written as
                    stanzas of six, aabbcc.

CULFf548.First Lines:
Be for sex days of paske at palme sounday it isIhesu sum to bethany
                    to duell þer I wis…
CULFf548.Last Lines:
…Þat wos broȝt to to cristendome þat sprede a boute
                    full wideȜet sais oure lorde to þe Iwes in þis ilke
                    tide…
CULFf548.Note:
Imperfect at end due to lost folios 93 and 94 (cut out of
                    MS)
CULFf548.Attributed Title: De Euandeliis aut sex dies passe (f. 87v)
CULFf548.Editions:
Downing,  Janay Young A.,
                        ed.  
             “A Critical Edition of Cambridge University MS Ff.5.48.” 
         2 vols. Diss. University of Washington, 1969: 238-48.

CamKC13.First Lines:
Bi fore six dayes of estar as a palm sonne eueIhesu wente to
                    bethanye þer to bi leue…
CamKC13.Last Lines:
…Now ihesu for þe swete crois þat þou were on y
                    doBring to þe blisse of heuene þat þou vs bouȝtest
                    to
CamKC13.Editions:
Downing,  Janay Young A.,
                        ed.  
             “A Critical Edition of Cambridge University MS Ff.5.48.” 
         2 vols. Diss. University of Washington, 1969: 238-48.

CamMagPep2344.First Lines:
By ffore six dayes of Ester as a palme sone eueIesus wente to
                    Bethanye þere to by leue…
CamMagPep2344.Last Lines:
…Now Ihesu ffor þe swete croys þat þou were on
                    ydoBryng vs to þe blisse of heuene þat þou vs bouȝtest
                    to
CamMagPep2344.Attributed Title:
Ewangelium in quadragesime (RT); Passio domini in Ewangelium
                        dicatur (RT); Assencio domini (RT); Pentecoste
                    (RT)
CamMagPep2344.Editions:
Brown,  Beatrice Daw,
                        ed.  
             The Southern Passion, Pepysian MS. 2344
EETS
         o.s. 169 (1927); repr. 1987.

CamTCC605.Transcription:
…& now many goud men doþ also precheþ aboute
                    lomeAc of prechyng hit worþ nede or þe day of dome
CamTCC605.Facsimiles:
Digital Facsimile of Trinity College Cambridge MS R.3.25.
         https://mss-cat.trin.cam.ac.uk/Manuscript/R.3.25.

BLCottVesAIII.First Lines:
Beside þe cros stode his modÞat was ful of
                    woo…
BLCottVesAIII.Last Lines:
…His body bode be taken donFor þe fest os i saide
                    ere
BLCottVesAIII.Note: An extract inserted in the text of Cursor Mundi.
BLCottVesAIII.Editions:
Morris,  Richard,
                        ed.  
             Cursor Mundi.
EETS
         o.s. 57 (1874); repr. 1961; 59 (1875); repr. 1966; 62 (1876); repr.
            1966; 66 (1877); repr. 1966; 68 (1878); repr. 1966; 101 (1893); repr. 1962: 956-65.
Brown,  Beatrice Daw,
                        ed.  
             The Southern Passion, Pepysian MS. 2344
EETS
         o.s. 169 (1927); repr. 1987: 55-61.

BLEge2891.First Lines: [   ]fter as apaline sone eue[   ]re to byleue…
BLEge2891.Last Lines: …Ac ich wene wolde cristendom bote miracles come amongffor we seeþ monnes heorte was euere hard an strong
BLEge2891.Note: 1413 lines. Beginnings of first 18 lines lost through damage to the leaf; 5809 embedded in this text.
BLEge2891.Attributed Title: Passio domini nostri Ihesu cristi secundum Mattheum (rubric in margin, f. 40)

BLHar2277.First Lines: Bifore six dayes of ester a palmsone eueIhesu crist com to betanye þer to bileue…
BLHar2277.Last Lines: …Nou ihesu for þe suete croice þat þu were on idoBring ous to þe ioye of heuene þat þu ous bouȝtest to
BLHar2277.Note:
Incomplete (1645 lines), twelve leaves missing between ff. 11 and
                    12. Saint Thomas (5809) embedded in this. Ends “Amen.”
BLHar2277.Facsimiles:
Digital Facsimile of British Library Harley MS 2277.
         https://www.bl.uk/manuscripts/FullDisplay.aspx?index=0&ref=Harley_MS_2277.
BLHar2277.Editions:
Brown,  Carleton Fairchild. 
             “The Cursor Mundi and the ‘Southern Passion’.” 
             Modern Language Notes
         26 (1911): 15-18: 15-18.

TokyoTak54.First Lines:
Tofore .vj. daies of Ester as on palmsoun eveThus came to Betanye
                    þer to bileve…
TokyoTak54.Last Lines:
…Now Ihesu for þe swete croys þat þou were on
                    ydoBring vs to þe Ioy of heuene þat þou hem brouȝtest
                    to. Amen.
